title: Add environment variable to prevent `setup.sh` from sourcing ROS and Gazebo's `setup.sh`

content.raw:
I have my own custom setups for ROS and Gazebo, and would prefer to have the drcsim setup.sh file only add file to the package paths, but not re-source ROS and Gazebo's setup files (effectively resetting our setups). I would like to source drcsim's setup.sh after the fact, adding its changes, because I use a custom ROS workspace and Gazebo installation prefix for switching version more easily.

I've attached a patch as a suggested implementation, adding test cases for DRCSIM_SKIP_ROS_SETUP and DRCSIM_SKIP_GAZEBO_SETUP bash variables, which skips those setups if enabled. I also added DRCSIM_CUSTOM_SETUP, which enables both options.

This patch was created from the drcsim_2.1 branch.
